title: Twin baby girl dies a day after being sent home from hospital with Calpol
text:

A brave mum has spoken about her baby daughter's tragic death after she unknowingly contracted sepsis.

Tragic Ellie Lunn, who was a twin, was just 11 months old when she died from the condition.

Mum Kerry Hill has spoken about Ellie's final hours in an effort to prevent it happening to other families.

Kerry, who lives in Ramsgate, Kent,said the first signs of the infection started to show when little Ellie refused food and began vomiting.

The tot had also not wet her nappy for more than 12 hours and a rash had started to develop on her stomach, Kent Live reports.

(Image: Kent Live / BPM Media)

After being seen by a GP, she was told to go to A&E where medics diagnosed viral tonsillitis and was sent home with Calpol and Dioralyte, which treats diarrhoea.

But Ellie died the following morning.

Ms Hill said: "Losing Ellie was simply heartbreaking and if her symptoms had been recognised earlier there’s a chance that things could have been different.

“According to the UK Sepsis Trust, five people are killed by sepsis every hour in the UK, making it one of the country’s biggest killers, and many people are still unsure of the signs and symptoms to look out for.

"By sharing my story, I hope to prevent other families having to go through the same thing."

Ms Hill, who is a compliance manager, is now holding a sepsis awareness conference to tell people about those crucial early signs.

She added: “Sepsis can affect anyone at any age, so the event is open to the general public as a whole and we are urging local schools, doctors and nurseries, in particular, to attend.”

The event will be held at Global Generation Church in Margate between 10am and 1pm on Thursday, November 14.

There will be talks from members of the NHS Critical Care Outreach team from the Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother Hospital in Margate.

It is these professionals who assess deteriorating patients on wards.

A paramedic will also explain the symptoms of sepsis, along with survivor Barbara Hall, who has had the condition as an adult.
description: Tragic Ellie Lunn, from Ramsgate, Kent, was just 11 months old when she died - now her mum is raising awareness of the deadly sepsis that killed her
